abilities.description: Allows the user to petrify anyone who feels lust or attraction toward them. The effect only works on those who harbor romantic or lustful feelings.
limitations: Does not affect those who feel no attraction to the user
Pure-hearted individuals like Luffy are immune

keyMoments.title: Luffy's Immunity to Mero Mero Powers
keyMoments.description: Hancock attempts to use her beauty to petrify Luffy but discovers he is completely immune to her powers because he feels no attraction toward her.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of the limitation of the Mero Mero no Mi - it requires the target to feel attraction to work. Luffy's immunity shocks Hancock and establishes their unique dynamic.

description: A Paramecia-type Devil Fruit that allows the user to turn anyone who feels attraction or lust toward them into stone. The user can also emit a heart-shaped beam that petrifies those with impure thoughts. Boa Hancock combines this power with her overwhelming beauty to devastating effect.
weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses (sea water, Seastone, Haki)
Does not work on those who feel no attraction
Can be resisted by pure-hearted individuals
trivia: The fruit's name comes from 'mero mero' (メロメロ), a Japanese phrase meaning 'to be infatuated' or 'head over heels in love'
Luffy is one of the few people shown to be completely immune to its primary effect
